content: So @Ryan Levick and @Jack Wrenn should both have write access to the repo, as will any future members of the wg-safe-transmute group (and lang/compiler/libs team members)
it may take a minute or two for that status to propagate
because I just landed https://github.com/rust-lang/team/pull/396
Thanks a bunch!
let me know if it doesn't work
Great! I'll create a branch and pr as soon as possible.
@nikomatsakis No idea what the usual delay is, but I still don't have access.
@Jack Wrenn mind if I open the PR so I can start giving feedback?
Oh, I can open a PR!
gimme one sec
:tada: https://github.com/rust-lang/project-safe-transmute/pull/5
hmm
it's true that you are not yet added to https://github.com/orgs/rust-lang/teams/wg-safe-transmute
oh, @Jack Wrenn, you have to accept https://github.com/orgs/rust-lang/invitations/jswrenn/ I think
Whoops, yep!
FYI: I'm adding comments to the PR, so I think we should leave it open for now
@Jack Wrenn would you mind if I sent the RFC to some colleagues for a look? This might be a good pre-step before posting it somewhere more visible.
I'd be delighted!!!
Also - we should let the lang and compiler teams know about this as well so they can read it before it gets posted should they want to. I'm not sure if @Josh Triplett was aware that it was posted.

@Jack Wrenn what would you like the next steps to be? It seems that the RFC is almost in a place where posting it to the RFCs repo would make sense. Did we want to have explicit feedback from the lang and compiler teams before posting?
Yes, I think getting feedback from the lang/compiler teams first makes the most sense.
:+1:
I look forward to reading the draft.

I look forward to your feedback, and apologize in advance for the length! I used the document to keep track of virtually every design decision I made and every consequence I observed; there very well might be things that should be cut out, or moved to an appendix.
That honestly sounds really promising.
As long as there's a clear "here's what we think we should do" path, I appreciate having all the "here's what we're not doing"s along the way.

I hope so! :grinning: Consequences are interspersed. (E.g., there's a bit of the guidance-level explanation of stability that's more like a nomicon-level explanation.) The what-we're-not-doings are mostly limited to the reference-level explanation, rationale, and prior art.

If you come across any points while reading where you find yourself wondering "why's it like that", let me know! There might be a handy forward-reference I can insert.
Alright. I should have time to review it later this week; let me know when it's ready for review.
@Josh Triplett it should be ready for review now. I think Jack is mostly making small changes at this point. https://github.com/rust-lang/project-safe-transmute/pull/5
